1.title: Live and Let Fly
1.plot: Hiccup and the gang start a secret club to prepare for the Outcast offensive.

2.title: The Iron Gronckle
2.plot: When Meatlug accidentally ingests magnetic rocks, she becomes magnetic herself - causing destruction through the town, but ultimately helping the kids win a battle against the Outcasts.

3.title: The Night and the Fury
3.plot: The kids go on a dragon survival training mission to Dragon Island, where they encounter Dagur, the Berserker Chief, who has become obsessed with hunting the Night Fury.

4.title: Tunnel Vision
4.plot: Hiccup discovers that the town's water shortage has been caused by the Outcasts' plan to hide Whispering Death eggs under Berk, which soon hatch and tunnel underthe island, threatening the villagers.

5.title: Race to Fireworm Island
5.plot: Hookfang is losing his ability to catch on fire, and it's up to Snotlout, Hiccup and the others to find the lair of the Fireworm Queen, which may hold the only possible cure, before it's too late.

6.title: Fright of Passage
6.plot: Hiccup must help Astrid face her fear of the terrifying Flightmare, a ghostly dragon that seemingly "froze" her uncle with fear, shaming her family name. With Fishlegs' help, they discover that there's more to the Flightmare than meets the eye.

7.title: Worst in Show
7.plot: A Terrible Terror training competition leads to a heated rivalry between Fishlegs and Snotlout, allowing Alvin to kidnap Meatlug. The kids must use their newly trained Terrors to rescue their friend.

8.title: Appetite for Destruction
8.plot: When dragons start fleeing to Dragon Island, the defenders must find out why the islands are disappearing.

9.title: Zippleback Down
9.plot: While searching for traps, Tuffnut, Barf and Belch get trapped themselves - and a forest fire is approaching.

10.title: A View to a Skrill: Part 1
10.plot: When the dragon riders discover a frozen Skrill, a lightning-powered dragon revered by the Berserkers, they scramble to get it off Berk.

11.title: A View to a Skrill Part 2
11.plot: Tuffnut goes undercover to help the defenders rescue a Skrill.

12.title: The Flight Stuff
12.plot: Snotlout becomes convinced he is dying, and leaves Hookfang to Gustav. But when he "miraculously" recovers, Snotlout takes his dragon back, and Gustav decides to get a dragon of his own (named Fanghook) and join the academy... whether they want him or not.

13.title: Free Scauldy
13.plot: Hiccup and co. discover an injured Scauldron on the shores of Changewing Island. The kids must heal the dragon and return him safely to the ocean, before he falls victim to the elements, as well as the territorial Changewings.

14.title: Frozen
14.plot: Hiccup and Toothless return from a mission to find Berk mysteriously empty. They discover that the village has been overrun by Speed Stingers, a venomous non-flying dragon that has trekked across the frozen sea to Berk.

15.title: A Tale of Two Dragons
15.plot: Hookfang and Stormfly quarrel while the town prepares for the harvest.

16.title: The Eel Effect
16.plot: Toothless catches a flu that spreads throughout Berk.

17.title: Smoke Gets in Your Eyes
17.plot: The mysterious theft of metal objects all over Berk reveals the presence of marauding Smokebreaths. Hiccup and Toothless soon discover that these dragons are the work of Dagur, in a plot to render Berk defenseless.

18.title: Bing! Bam! Boom!
18.plot: When three adolescent Thunderdrums attack the village, only Stoick's Thornado can bring chaos to order.

19.title: Cast Out, Part I
19.plot: Snotlout is expelled from the academy; Alvin returns to Berk to make amends.

20.title: Cast Out: Part II
20.plot: Hiccup cautiously accepts Alvin's help on a mission to rescue Stoick from Dagur's clutches. The dragon riders, the Berserkers and the Screaming Death all converge on Outcast Island, for a war that may decide the fate of the archipelago.

1.title: How to Start a Dragon Academy
1.plot: With the Dragons causing intolerable friction with the Berkians with their instinctual habits, Hiccup must enable a reasonable co-habitation.

2.title: Viking for Hire
2.plot: With Gobber feeling useless with the Dragon peace, Hiccup must find a new role for him.

3.title: Animal House
3.plot: As the dragons become more comfortable as a part of Berk society, the livestock are becoming less comfortable - fire-breathing predators are, after all, around every corner. As a result, Berk is running low on eggs, milk and other food supplies.

4.title: The Terrible Twos
4.plot: The Dragon Riders find a small dragon in the woods, which Hiccup is volunteered to take home.

5.title: In Dragons We Trust
5.plot: When the dragons are blamed for a series of damages around the village, Hiccup and the kids form the Dragon United Monitoring Brigade (aka DUMB).

6.title: Alvin and the Outcasts
6.plot: After the dragons are banished from the island, Hiccup searches for evidence to prove their innocence.

7.title: How to Pick Your Dragon
7.plot: Stoick resolves to learn dragon riding himself from Hiccup, but he seems to prefer Toothless to his son's annoyance.

8.title: Portrait of Hiccup as a Buff Man
8.plot: When Stoick has a portrait of himself and Hiccup painted for the collection in the Great Hall, Hiccup ends up depicted as a strong, burly Viking, not his usual skinny self.

9.title: Dragon Flower
9.plot: When the Riders discover that Mildew deliberately sickened the dragons with a special flower, Hiccup and Stoick force him along to find a cure.

10.title: Heather Report Part 1
10.plot: The Riders take in a lost girl who seems strangely curious about dragon training.

11.title: Heather Report, Part II
11.plot: After Heather's betrayal leaves the Book of Dragons in the hands of the Outcasts, the kids devise a plan for Astrid to disguise herself as Heather, sneak onto Outcast Island, and retrieve the book from Alvin and the Outcasts.

12.title: Thawfest
12.plot: For his entire life, Snotlout has been beating Hiccup and the others in the Thawfest games. But this year, the games include dragon-based events, and Hiccup is determined to finally win.

13.title: When Lightning Strikes
13.plot: When a series of lightning storms hit Berk, Mildew claims Thor is angry at the village for allowing Toothless, a Night Fury, to live among them. Hiccup must prove Toothless's innocence as he and Stoick face an uprising against Toothless.

14.title: What Flies Beneath
14.plot: A rogue dragon - a Whispering Death - shows up in Berk, tearing up the village. He's on a mission - to find Toothless and settle a score.

15.title: Twinsanity
15.plot: When Ruffnut and Tuffnut have a falling out, Hiccup and the kids must reunite them before their wayward Zippleback is discovered by Dagur the Deranged, the visiting chief from the fearsome Berserker tribe.

16.title: Defiant One
16.plot: Hiccup and Snotlout face difficulties getting home from Outcast Island.

17.title: Breackneck Bog
17.plot: The gang visit a haunted bog to retrieve a lost gift for Hiccup.

18.title: Gem of a Different Color
18.plot: Fishlegs discovers a gem that is of great value to a flock of dangerous Changewings.

19.title: We Are Family: Part 1
19.plot: With Bork Day, the annual holiday celebrating the village's history, fast approaching, Stoick bestows Hiccup with all of Bork's notes and studies on dragons.

20.title: We Are Family: Part 2
20.plot: Conclusion. Hiccup and Toothless hatch an escape plan after being trapped on Outcast Island.

imdb.plot outline: After Hiccup and his Night Fury companion, Toothless, saved the people of Berk by defeating the Red Death, they inspired the Vikings of Berk to make peace with the dragons. However, Hiccup learns that the co-habitation is far from harmonious with Viking ignorance and the Dragons' instincts threatening to destroy the alliance. To solve the problem, Hiccup's father, Stoick the Vast, organizes the Berk Dragon Academy where his son and friends can learn all about Dragons. Even as grumpy doubters like Mildew and villains like Alvin the Treacherous oppose them, the Viking teens of Berk and their dragons dedicate themselves to achieving a vital understanding.
imdb.title: Dragons: Riders of Berk
plot: The further adventures of Hiccup and his friends on the Island of Berk.::Kenneth Chisholm

After Hiccup and his Night Fury companion, Toothless, saved the people of Berk by defeating the Red Death, they inspired the Vikings of Berk to make peace with the dragons. However, Hiccup learns that the co-habitation is far from harmonious with Viking ignorance and the Dragons' instincts threatening to destroy the alliance. To solve the problem, Hiccup's father, Stoick the Vast, organizes the Berk Dragon Academy where his son and friends can learn all about Dragons. Even as grumpy doubters like Mildew and villains like Alvin the Treacherous oppose them, the Viking teens of Berk and their dragons dedicate themselves to achieving a vital understanding.::Kenneth Chisholm (kchishol@rogers.com)
